  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      A board consist in a tri-dimensional array of cells; Dimensions of a cell are x,y,z.

      The zCoordrepresent the level of the cell.

      It's possible to build a block also in cell at zCoord = 0 On a cell at a certain level we can have both a worker and a block(of course following game's rules).

      So, for example, if we have a worker and a block at (x,y,0), it means there is a worker at level1, because there is a Block B1 present.

      IMPORTANT: At (x,y,0), it's possible to have a worker without a block, and so the worker is standing at level0. It's not like this for cells at (x,y,z) with z>0; in this case it's only possible to have a block, or a worker and a block, since a worker cannot stand in an higher level if there is not a block under his feet.

  • Method Details

    • setPlayingNow

      public void setPlayingNow​(Player playingNow)

    • blockInCell

      public Block blockInCell​(int x, int y)
      The function return the highest block built in the cell at (x,y)

      Parameters:
      x - xCoord of the cell that need to be checked
      y - yCoord of the cell that need to be checked
      Returns:
      The last Block built in the cell at (x,y); null if no block is detected

    • workerInCell

      public Worker workerInCell​(int x, int y)
      The function return the only worker present in the cell at (x,y), checking every level.

      Parameters:
      x - xCoord of the cell that need to be checked
      y - yCoord of the cell that need to be checked
      Returns:
      The Worker who stand on the cell at (x,y); null if no worker is detected

    • getLastBusyCell

      public Cell getLastBusyCell​(int x, int y)
      Check the last "busy" level for the cell at (x,y).

      A level is busy when is occupied by: a block, a worker, or both of them

      Parameters:
      x - xCoord of the cell that need to be checked
      y - yCoord of the cell that need to be checked
      Returns:
      The last busy cell at (x,y); null if no worker or block is detected
      See Also:
      Board()

    • getFirstBuildableCell

      public Cell getFirstBuildableCell​(int x, int y)
      Return the first level at (x,y), where is possible to build a new block. Typically returns getLastBusyCell +1

      If there is only a worker at level0, so no block is present at(x,y) at any level, it returns cell[x][y][0].

      Parameters:
      x - xCoord of the cell that need to be checked
      y - yCoord of the cell that need to be checked
      Returns:
      The first buildable cell at (x,y);

      null if there is a block(DORSE) built at level3, and so it's not possible build anymore at (x,y)

      See Also:
      getLastBusyCell(int x, int y)

    • getDistance

      public int[] getDistance​(Cell c1, Cell c2)
      Return the distance of various coord between 2 cells.

      For the xCoord and yCoord it return the absolute value of distance, that can only be >0

      For the zCoord it return the simple value of distance, that can be <0 or >0

      Parameters:
      c1 - First cell
      c2 - Second cell
      Returns:
      An array with 3 position:

      array[0] =

      |c1.xCoord - c2.xCoord| note the absolute value

      array[1] =

      |c1.yCoord - c2.yCoord| note the absolute value

      array[2] =

      c1.zCoord - c2.zCoord

    • forceMove

      protected boolean forceMove​(@NotNull Cell c, Worker w)
      The "force" means that the function doesn't check if the move is allowed by the rules or not. These controls are made in match
      Parameters:
      c - Destination cell
      w - Worker that need to be moved
      Returns:
      true if the move was correctly performed; false otherwise
      See Also:
      Match

      Parameters:
      c - Cell where a new block will be built
      Returns:
      The block just added
      See Also:
